climbs.name: Super Roof
climbs.fa: Dave Ohlsen, Jon Lonne and Martin McBirney, April 1975

content.description:
Scramble onto a ledge to begin and climb the imposing roof above, which is easier than it first appears. The descent is down easy ledges to the climber's right.

Take care not to get your rope stuck as it happens more often than you might think.
content.location:
Super Roof is the obvious roof crack 15 feet left of a prominent off-width roof crack -

Comfortably Numb

.

climbs.name: Let's Get Horizontal
climbs.fa: (TR) Kelly and Jeff Rhoads, October 1982, FL: Chris Miller 1998

content.description:
Scramble/climb up to a small ledge where the actual climbing begins, and then climb up the vertical face (optional pro below the roof) and out the roof on positive holds to enjoyable climbing above, passing a horizontal crack (gear to 2.5 inches) and up to the top. Descend as per Super Roof. Two stars out of five.

A unique route for the area in that it features steep, well-protected moves on mostly large, incut features.

* Originally sported 4 bolts and bolted anchors.
content.location:
Located just left of

Super Roof

.

content.description:
Right of Super Roof is this wide roof crack.  Short but clean.

If you set a toprope, make sure the rope stays out of the crack.  Otherwise you risk a bad swing into the face below.
